brief: Draws a Bézier curve on the screen
name: bezier()
description:
Draws a Bézier curve on the screen. These curves are defined by a series
 of anchor and control points. The first two parameters specify the first
 anchor point and the last two parameters specify the other anchor point.
 The middle parameters specify the control points which define the shape
 of the curve. The curves were developed by French engineer Pierre
 Bezier. Using the 3D version requires rendering with P3D (see the
 Environment reference for more information).
syntax: bezier(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4)
bezier(x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2, x3, y3, z3, x4, y4, z4)

parameters.name: x1
parameters.description: coordinates for the first anchor point

parameters.name: y1
parameters.description: coordinates for the first anchor point

parameters.name: z1
parameters.description: coordinates for the first anchor point

parameters.name: x2
parameters.description: coordinates for the first control point

parameters.name: y2
parameters.description: coordinates for the first control point

parameters.name: z2
parameters.description: coordinates for the first control point

parameters.name: x3
parameters.description: coordinates for the second control point

parameters.name: y3
parameters.description: coordinates for the second control point

parameters.name: z3
parameters.description: coordinates for the second control point

parameters.name: x4
parameters.description: coordinates for the second anchor point

parameters.name: y4
parameters.description: coordinates for the second anchor point

parameters.name: z4
parameters.description: coordinates for the second anchor point
